subject: Medicine
title: Designer Babies
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Designer Babies.

hook.text: Parents can already select embryos for sex and screen for diseases. Choosing eye color and IQ may be next.

buildup.text: Preimplantation genetic testing screens IVF embryos for genetic conditions before implantation.

discovery.text: The technology is expanding from disease prevention to trait selectionâ€”raising fears of genetic inequality.

twist.text: If only wealthy parents can afford genetic enhancement, society could split into genetic haves and have-nots.

climax.text: The line between treating disease and enhancing humans is blurringâ€”and ethics must draw it before science erases it.

punchline.text: Designing babies is possible. Designing the rules isn't yet.

quiz.question: What social risk does genetic enhancement technology pose?
options: It could create a divide between genetic haves and have-nots
It would make all humans genetically identical
Only governments could access the technology
